name: Choosing_Genomics_Tools
description: Based on their genomic data types and goals, this course will help learners find educational resources and tools to help them process and interpret data.

name: AI_for_Efficient_Programming
description: This course on AI for software development explores the use of AI large language models (ChatGPT, Bard, etc) and their potential benefits and challenges. Hands-on activities show the ways in which AI can speed up software development tasks and free up time for more creative and strategic work, maximizing benefits/efficiency while limiting harm.

name: Adv_Reproducibility_in_Cancer_Informatics
description: This course introduces more advanced tools to increase the reproducibility of data analyses; building upon the Intro to Reproducibility course. GitHub, Docker, Code Review, and GitHub actions are discussed.

name: Computing_for_Cancer_Informatics
description: This course is designed to help investigators understand more about computing basics, as well as familiarize researchers with various computing platform options.

name: Informatics_Research_Leadership
description: This course covers the pitfalls of informatics research and discusses best practices and tools to overcome the challenges of working with and managing multidisciplinary teams. It also covers guidelines to promote diversity and inclusion in your lab and research.

name: Reproducibility_in_Cancer_Informatics
description: This course introduces the concepts of reproducibility and replicability in the context of cancer informatics. It is the first course in a two part course on reproducibility. It uses hands-on exercises to demonstrate in practical terms how to increase the reproducibility of data analyses.
CourseName: Intro to Reproducibility in Cancer Informatics

name: Documentation_and_Usability
description: This course covers the basics of creating documentation and tutorials to maximize the usability of informatics tools. It is meant for individuals developing tools for informatics.

name: Overleaf_and_LaTeX_for_Scientific_Articles
description: This course is designed to help researchers and trainees write scientific articles using LaTeX and Overleaf.
CourseName: Write Smarter with Overleaf and LaTeX

name: Ethical_Data_Handling_for_Cancer_Research
description: This course is designed to help researchers and investigators understand the key principles of data management from an ethics, privacy, security, usability and discoverability perspective.

name: GitHub_Automation_for_Scientists
description: This course walks through why's and the how's for using automation to boost scientific software development process.

name: Containers_for_Scientists
description: This course covers how to use containers for scientific software development. Scientific software benefits from the concepts of continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD). Containers play a critical role in CI/CD by providing a consistent, portable, and isolated environment for building, testing, and deploying software.

name: AI_for_Decision_Makers
description: This set of four mini courses helps leaders make strategic decisions, drive innovation, enhance efficiency, and foster a culture that embraces the transformative power of these technologies.

name: NIH_Data_Sharing
description: Learn about the new NIH data sharing policy, places where you might want to share your particular kind of data, and how to deal with possible challenges associated with the policy.
CourseName: Data Management and Sharing for NIH Proposals
